title: Prince Harry’s secret visit to UK: Duke reunited with brother William at uncle’s funeral — But did they speak?
content: Prince Harry and Prince William attended the funeral of their uncle, Lord Robert Fellowes, at St Mary’s Church in Norfolk. Keeping a distance, the brothers did not interact during the service. Lord Fellowes, Princess Diana's brother-in-law, was a former Private Secretary to Queen Elizabeth II and played a significant role in the Royal Household.
summary: Prince Harry and Prince William attended the funeral of their uncle, Lord Robert Fellowes, at St Mary’s Church in Norfolk. Keeping a distance, the brothers did not interact during the service. Lord Fellowes, Princess Diana's brother-in-law, was a former Private Secretary to Queen Elizabeth II and played a significant role in the Royal Household.

title: Typhoon Shanshan brings torrential rains, travel turmoil across Japan
content: Typhoon Shanshan battered Japan with heavy rain and winds, leading to power outages, travel disruptions, and production halts. Millions were advised to evacuate as the storm resulted in fatalities and injuries. Major factories, including those of automakers and electronics firms, temporarily suspended operations. Airlines canceled numerous flights, affecting many travelers.
summary: Typhoon Shanshan battered Japan with heavy rain and winds, leading to power outages, travel disruptions, and production halts. Millions were advised to evacuate as the storm resulted in fatalities and injuries. Major factories, including those of automakers and electronics firms, temporarily suspended operations. Airlines canceled numerous flights, affecting many travelers.

title: Hush money case: Trump seeks federal court intervention in bid to overturn conviction
content: Donald Trump's legal team has petitioned a federal court to step in on his hush money criminal case, aiming to reverse his conviction and delay sentencing. They argue that the state-level prosecution breaches his constitutional rights and supreme court rulings on presidential immunity, seeking a transfer to federal court for a fair trial.
summary: Donald Trump's legal team has petitioned a federal court to step in on his hush money criminal case, aiming to reverse his conviction and delay sentencing. They argue that the state-level prosecution breaches his constitutional rights and supreme court rulings on presidential immunity, seeking a transfer to federal court for a fair trial.

title: US elections 2024: Kamala Harris talks policy, Trump, and future plans along with Tim Walz in CNN interview - Key takeaways
content: Kamala Harris, in a CNN interview, emphasized priority shifts from Trump's divisive agenda, focusing on economic reforms and a tax credit for parents. She maintained her stance on fracking, discussed border security, and highlighted Biden's achievements. Harris expressed openness to Republicans and shared personal reflections while defending Biden's leadership and contrasting it with Trump.
summary: Kamala Harris, in a CNN interview, emphasized priority shifts from Trump's divisive agenda, focusing on economic reforms and a tax credit for parents. She maintained her stance on fracking, discussed border security, and highlighted Biden's achievements. Harris expressed openness to Republicans and shared personal reflections while defending Biden's leadership and contrasting it with Trump.

title: US NSA Sullivan and Xi Jinping seek stable America-China relations amid rising tensions: ‘Competition does not have to lead to conflict’
content: Xi Jinping met with US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan to discuss maintaining open communication amid rising tensions. Both affirmed the need for stable US-China relations, away from conflict. Sensitive topics like Taiwan and China’s support for Russia were discussed, with planned future communication between leaders and military commanders in the Indo-Pacific region.
summary: Xi Jinping met with US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan to discuss maintaining open communication amid rising tensions. Both affirmed the need for stable US-China relations, away from conflict. Sensitive topics like Taiwan and China’s support for Russia were discussed, with planned future communication between leaders and military commanders in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: ‘We want more babies’: Trump promises free IVF treatments amid abortion rights debate, says ‘US government will pay’ — But how?
content: Donald Trump revealed that his administration would ensure insurance companies cover all costs related to IVF treatments. This announcement comes amidst criticism for appointing justices who overturned federal abortion rights. Trump also mentioned a tax deduction for newborn care expenses, highlighting a pro-family stance.
summary: Donald Trump revealed that his administration would ensure insurance companies cover all costs related to IVF treatments. This announcement comes amidst criticism for appointing justices who overturned federal abortion rights. Trump also mentioned a tax deduction for newborn care expenses, highlighting a pro-family stance.

title: Kamala Harris explains policy shifts and cabinet plans in first interview on CNN: 'My values have not changed'
content: Vice President Kamala Harris, during an exclusive interview, explained her evolving positions on fracking and immigration while asserting that her core values remain unchanged. She highlighted her commitment to diverse leadership and mentioned the possibility of including a Republican in her Cabinet. Harris dismissed Donald Trump's recent remarks about her racial identity as outdated.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, during an exclusive interview, explained her evolving positions on fracking and immigration while asserting that her core values remain unchanged. She highlighted her commitment to diverse leadership and mentioned the possibility of including a Republican in her Cabinet. Harris dismissed Donald Trump's recent remarks about her racial identity as outdated.

title: ‘What do you have to lose?’: Vance booed for questioning union what Democrats have 'gotten you'
content: At the Fire Fighters Convention in Boston, Republican VP nominee JD Vance was met with boos after he questioned the union's allegiance to Democrats and promoted the Trump-Vance ticket. He urged reconsideration of political ties, citing economic hardships, while promising labor support, public safety, and opposing COVID mandates.
summary: At the Fire Fighters Convention in Boston, Republican VP nominee JD Vance was met with boos after he questioned the union's allegiance to Democrats and promoted the Trump-Vance ticket. He urged reconsideration of political ties, citing economic hardships, while promising labor support, public safety, and opposing COVID mandates.

title: Ukraine's top pilot killed after US-made F-16 fighter jet crashed during Russian missile attack
content: A Ukrainian F-16 fighter jet, recently delivered by NATO allies, was downed this week during a defense against a massive Russian aerial assault, killing the pilot. Ukraine's air force has initiated an investigation into the crash, potentially due to pilot error or mechanical failure, underscoring the intense challenges Ukraine faces.
summary: A Ukrainian F-16 fighter jet, recently delivered by NATO allies, was downed this week during a defense against a massive Russian aerial assault, killing the pilot. Ukraine's air force has initiated an investigation into the crash, potentially due to pilot error or mechanical failure, underscoring the intense challenges Ukraine faces.

title: Editors convicted of sedition in Hong Kong, face upto 2 years in jail
content: Hong Kong's court has convicted Chung Pui-kuen and Patrick Lam, editors of the defunct Stand News, for conspiracy to publish seditious articles. They face up to two years of imprisonment when sentenced on Sept. 26. This marks the first sedition conviction in media since 1997's handover, attracting international media critiques.
summary: Hong Kong's court has convicted Chung Pui-kuen and Patrick Lam, editors of the defunct Stand News, for conspiracy to publish seditious articles. They face up to two years of imprisonment when sentenced on Sept. 26. This marks the first sedition conviction in media since 1997's handover, attracting international media critiques.

title: 'Curious' 4-year-old boy breaks a 3,500-year-old jar during museum visit
content: A 3,500-year-old jar from the Middle Bronze Age on display at Israel's Hecht Museum was shattered when a 4-year-old boy accidentally knocked it over. The museum, which typically allows close visitor access to artifacts, will restore the jar, and the family will be invited back to witness the restoration process.
summary: A 3,500-year-old jar from the Middle Bronze Age on display at Israel's Hecht Museum was shattered when a 4-year-old boy accidentally knocked it over. The museum, which typically allows close visitor access to artifacts, will restore the jar, and the family will be invited back to witness the restoration process.

title: Hasina's commerce minister arrested in murder case
content: The interim government of Bangladesh has ramped up its efforts against prominent Awami League leaders, arresting ex-commerce minister Tipu Munshi linked to a murder case. Legal proceedings are ongoing against former PM Sheikh Hasina and 52 others at the International Crimes Tribunal, accusing them of crimes against humanity and inciting genocide during student demonstrations.
summary: The interim government of Bangladesh has ramped up its efforts against prominent Awami League leaders, arresting ex-commerce minister Tipu Munshi linked to a murder case. Legal proceedings are ongoing against former PM Sheikh Hasina and 52 others at the International Crimes Tribunal, accusing them of crimes against humanity and inciting genocide during student demonstrations.

title: 'Same old tired playbook': Kamala fires back at Trump's 'happened to turn Black' comment
content: In a CNN interview, Kamala Harris dismissed Donald Trump's comments on her racial identity, calling them outdated. She reaffirmed her consistent values and commitment to serve all Americans. Harris hinted at including a Republican in her Cabinet if elected. This is Harris's first interview since Joe Biden withdrew from the presidential race in late July.
summary: In a CNN interview, Kamala Harris dismissed Donald Trump's comments on her racial identity, calling them outdated. She reaffirmed her consistent values and commitment to serve all Americans. Harris hinted at including a Republican in her Cabinet if elected. This is Harris's first interview since Joe Biden withdrew from the presidential race in late July.

title: Harris widens her lead over Trump with boost from women: New poll
content: Kamala Harris holds a 45% to 41% lead over Donald Trump in a Reuters/Ipsos poll conducted ahead of the November 5 election. The poll reveals strong support for Harris among women and Hispanics, enhancing her standing. Trump retains a lead among white voters and men. The survey gathered responses from over 4,200 adults, including registered voters.
summary: Kamala Harris holds a 45% to 41% lead over Donald Trump in a Reuters/Ipsos poll conducted ahead of the November 5 election. The poll reveals strong support for Harris among women and Hispanics, enhancing her standing. Trump retains a lead among white voters and men. The survey gathered responses from over 4,200 adults, including registered voters.

title: US court: TikTok must face suit for child's 'blackout challenge' death
content: A US appeals court has renewed a lawsuit filed by the mother of a 10-year-old girl who died after trying a TikTok challenge involving self-choking. The court indicated TikTok might be responsible for promoting such content despite federal laws shielding online publishers from liability for user-posted content.
summary: A US appeals court has renewed a lawsuit filed by the mother of a 10-year-old girl who died after trying a TikTok challenge involving self-choking. The court indicated TikTok might be responsible for promoting such content despite federal laws shielding online publishers from liability for user-posted content.

title: 'I don't keep track of...':Emmanuel Macron says he was unaware of Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrival in France
content: President Emmanuel Macron disclosed he was unaware of Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrival in France on August 24. Arrested for multiple charges, Durov is being investigated for facilitating criminal activities on his platform. Macron also defended France's decision to grant Durov French citizenship in 2021 under a special procedure for notable individuals. He had earlier clarified that Durov's arrest was part of a judicial investigation and not politically driven.
summary: President Emmanuel Macron disclosed he was unaware of Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrival in France on August 24. Arrested for multiple charges, Durov is being investigated for facilitating criminal activities on his platform. Macron also defended France's decision to grant Durov French citizenship in 2021 under a special procedure for notable individuals.  He had earlier clarified that Durov's arrest was part of a judicial investigation and not politically driven.

title: Kamala Harris says her values have not changed, she'd name a Republican in Cabinet if elected
content: In her first interview after being nominated as the presidential candidate which would be telecast live later tonight on CNN, Kamala Harris said her values have not changed. Her time as vice president provided new perspective on some of the issues, Kamala Harris said explaining her change of stance on immigration and fracking, She said she would name a Republican to serve in her Cabinet if elected.
summary: In her first interview after being nominated as the presidential candidate which would be telecast live later tonight on CNN, Kamala Harris said her values have not changed. Her time as vice president provided new perspective on some of the issues, Kamala Harris said explaining her change of stance on immigration and fracking, She said she would name a Republican to serve in her Cabinet if elected.

title: Wells Fargo employee found dead in office cubicle four days after clocking in
content: Tempe police are investigating the death of a Wells Fargo employee, Denise Prudhomme, who was found dead at her office after four days. Police have stated that there is no suspicion of foul play, but many details about the exact timing and cause of death remain unclear. The discovery has raised workplace safety concerns and frustration over the lack of timely action. Wells Fargo is cooperating with authorities and offering counseling services to its employees.
summary: Tempe police are investigating the death of a Wells Fargo employee, Denise Prudhomme, who was found dead at her office after four days. Police have stated that there is no suspicion of foul play, but many details about the exact timing and cause of death remain unclear. The discovery has raised workplace safety concerns and frustration over the lack of timely action. Wells Fargo is cooperating with authorities and offering counseling services to its employees.

title: Harris' team pushes back as ABC News says it will mute mics during Trump-Kamala debate
content: ​The ABC news Thursday confirmed that the September 10 debate on the channel will have the same rules as the CNN debate and the mics will be muted when the other candidate is speaking. Kamala Harris' team wanted mics to be unmuted but ABC News rejected the request. Like the CNN debate, there will be no audience, no notes and they will not be allowed to speak when the other candidate is speaking.
summary: ​The ABC news Thursday confirmed that the September 10 debate on the channel will have the same rules as the CNN debate and the mics will be muted when the other candidate is speaking. Kamala Harris' team wanted mics to be unmuted but ABC News rejected the request. Like the CNN debate, there will be no audience, no notes and they will not be allowed to speak when the other candidate is speaking.

title: 21-year-old student from Nepal found dead in Houston after armed robbery
content: Muna Pandey, a 21-year-old community college student from Nepal, was found shot dead in her Houston apartment following an armed robbery. Police have arrested Bobby Sinh Shah, 52, in connection with the crime. Pandey had moved to Houston from Nepal in 2021, as noted by a GoFundMe fundraiser set up for her.
summary: Muna Pandey, a 21-year-old community college student from Nepal, was found shot dead in her Houston apartment following an armed robbery. Police have arrested Bobby Sinh Shah, 52, in connection with the crime. Pandey had moved to Houston from Nepal in 2021, as noted by a GoFundMe fundraiser set up for her.
